title: 'I had no eyedea!': Former UFC champion Michael Bisping shocks viewers as he pops out fake EYEBALL
text:
Former UFC middleweight champion Michael Bisping shocked viewers of his live podcast as he removed his fake right eyeball... and then popped it straight back in!

Bisping fought for five years after suffering a detached retina in a loss in Brazil against Vitor Belfort in January 2013.

After enduring five separate operations on his right eye, Bisping was able to fight again and won the UFC Middleweight Championship in 2016 at UFC 199.

SCROLL DOWN FOR VIDEO - WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT

Michael Bisping points towards his eye live on air with viewers unaware of what was to come

The Mancunian then digs his index finger into his right eye to force the prosthetic out

Bisping can briefly be seen with no eyeball in his right eye socket, before he pops it back in

Michael Bisping is a legend. pic.twitter.com/fg1TG4SwnO — Borrachinha Depot (@FullContactMTWF) October 3, 2019

Although he finished his career in 2017 with two defeats, against Georges St-Pierre and Kelvin Gastelum, fans are aghast that he was able to fight at all given his injury.

In response to the video, @Matt__McCann tweeted: 'Wow I literally had no eyedea.'

In the process of popping out his fake eyeball on his Believe You Me show, Bisping said: 'I wore my dark glasses to hide from the commission.

'That's why I used to wear f***ing sunglasses, baby boy!'

The 40-year-old squeezes the eyeball back into its socket to finish a remarkable few seconds

Wow I literally had no eyedea 👀 — Matt (@Matt__McCann) October 3, 2019

The 40-year-old recently explained to MMA Junkie just how close he was to being forced into early retirement due to the injury.

'I was just about able to scrape past the medicals,' Bisping said.

'It was definitely touch and go; I was always terrified of doing a full training camp, then being turned away by the commission doctor.

'It was difficult. To pass the medical test, you've got to have 20-200 vision, which is classed as clinically blind anyway, so it's not very good – it's not a very hard mark to pass.

Bisping won the UFC Middleweight Championship and is seen here at a 2016 fight in London

'Some days I could, some days I couldn't, but fortunately, I was just able to scrape by.

'People always say: 'How did you fight with only one eye?' And I always say: 'With great f***ing difficulty!'

Since retiring, Bisping has turned his hand to acting, appearing briefly in the 2018 thriller Den of Thieves, starring Gerard Butler.
